comments:
I attempted to perform a checkout for 3 times, each giving me different error 
message and the checkout is unsuccessful.

1. When checking out a project for the first time, authenication is rejected, 
although the username and password are right:

[aying@ceilidh org.eclipse.stellation.misc]$ svc 
--location=remote:svc:6060:stellation -username=aying -password=aying4you 
checkout org.eclipse.stellation.misc
Remote authentication rejected

2.  When checkout out the same project for the second time, a 
NullPointerException is thrown.

[aying@ceilidh org.eclipse.stellation.misc]$  svc 
--location=remote:svc:6060:stellation --username=aying --password=aying4you 
checkout org.eclipse.stellation.misc
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.apache.oro.text.perl.Perl5Util.match(Unknown Source)
        at 
org.eclipse.stellation.comm.messaging.Connection.receiveIdentityMessage(Connection.java:91)
        at 
org.eclipse.stellation.comm.messaging.Connection.<init>(Connection.java:64)
        at 
org.eclipse.stellation.comm.messaging.Engine.openConnection(Engine.java:496)
        at 
org.eclipse.stellation.repos.messaging.client.RemoteAccessPoint.<init>(RemoteAccessPoint.java:39)
        at 
org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Connection.getAccessPoint(Connection.java:191)
        at 
org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Connection.open(Connection.java:107)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Checkout.command(Checkout.java:106)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Svc.command(Svc.java:81)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Svc.run(Svc.java:540)
        at org.eclipse.stellation.workspace.Svc.main(Svc.java:333)
 

3.  When I do the checkout again, it says connection is refused.

[aying@ceilidh org.eclipse.stellation.misc]$ svc 
--location=remote:svc:6060:stellation -username=aying -password=aying4you 
checkout org.eclipse.stellation.misc
Connection refused

The log shows that Annie's checkout had a username of "sername". I suspect  
that this is indicative of a problem in the options processing. 
 
There's a second problem here, which is that the server stopped. This may  
have been caused by the auth failure. (It may also be a HUP glitch, since 
I was running the server under my UID, not root.) I'll look into the crash 
problem, but I think the options processing stuff is clearly in Dave's 
territory.

On attempting to reproduce, I realized that the "-username" only had one  
dash, and so was correctly being interpreted as "-u". Thus, no bug here.  
  
The server stop was a HUP, due to running the server manually from a non-root  
account. Annie's second login crashed with a null pointer because my logout 
took down the server in the middle of her login. 
 
Unfortunately, because this is assigned to Dave, I can't mark it resolved.
